content.description:
This is the short but nice, wind polished, crystally face on the opposite side of the cluster from

The Hobgoblin

.  Start compressing with a high and tiny left hand pinch and a decent right hand side pull on a big crystal.  Unless you are very tall, you may need to stand on pads reach the left hand starting hold.  Establish on the face, make a couple of delicate moves, then do a little dyno for the top.  This is a fun one to do when you come out for

The Hobgoblin

.
content.location:
This is on the opposite side of the cluster of boulders from

The Hobgoblin

.

content.description: This is the obvious hands to offwidth roof formed between two closely matched boulders.  It leans at a bit of an angle, and the inside of the crack is polished smooth by the wind.  A great place to learn some tricks for offwidth roofs.  Pulling the lip is not too bad.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter are nice.  The landing is nice and flat, but it would hurt to take a backslapper out of it.
content.location: This is up on the hill, in the pile of rocks.  There is also a short crystal pulling problem on the knobby face straight back from The hobgoblin, and another roof crack around the corner to its left.
